landing.explanation1: A global pandemic has arrived in your backyard. This virus can be transmitted before symptoms appear, and it has the potential to spread throughout the entire community—unless you take action now through physical distancing. Every week is crucial for saving thousands of lives.
landing.explanation2: But you can’t do this alone! It’ll take the cooperation of the entire community to slow the spread of this disease. Together, you’ll have to find ways to meet your individual needs while limiting your outings as much as possible.
landing.explanation3: You will play alongside a team of real people.
landing.explanation4: Your teammates have played before you, and have made the weekly decisions you are about to.  Their decisions and yours together will determine how frequently people in your community leave their homes each week, for the duration of five weeks.
landing.explanation5:
Your collective decisions will determine how many lives are lost or saved.
Together, your goal is to save as many lives as possible.
landing.instruction1: To start, enter your zip code* or choose a community size.
landing.instruction2: We’ll pull real data to set up the game with your community’s actual population and number of available hospital beds.
landing.joinTeamSubtext: You will play alongside {count} of your teammates. | You will play alongside {count} of your {total} teammates.
landing.joinRandomSubtext: You will play alongside {count} other real people.
landing.NPCDisclaimer: for teams with less than 20 people, NPCs will fill in and go about business as usual.
landing.zipCodeDisclaimer: <sup>*unfortunately, we currently only support US zip codes.</sup>

decide.rest: and here's what the rest of your team decided to do:
decide.businessAsUsual:
Your local government is now considering going back to business as usual. Would you like to see what the next four weeks might look like if everyone in your community went about like normal again*?

*you won't have to make any more decisions.

end.closerLook: Here's a closer look at the numbers:
end.numbers: Your community had {total} total cases, including {deaths} deaths. However, this is {avoided} less cases than if your community had gone on with business as usual, and your team was able to save {saved} lives.
end.together: You may have felt that your decisions had little influence over the weeks—but in fact, your community was able to achieve these numbers precisely because of your decisions, compounded by the decision of everyone else in your team:
end.future: In turn, your future teammates will be helped by the decisions you made today.
end.influence: This is reflected in the real world: when everyone who can stay home chooses to stay home as much as possible, the most infections are avoided. Slower infection rates mean that hospitals and first responders can better help the sickest members of our community.
end.share: So, take a moment to share this game with your friends, family, and neighbors and work to flatten the curve, together.

footnotes.fullDisclaimer:
While the disease spread in this game is modeled after COVID-19, it uses a simplified model not intended to be a precise forecast. We want to emphasize that we're modeling a virus, not the virus.

For more details, please see our full methodology.

Read the full, detailed methodology here.
